channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. rock climber Alex Honnold reaches top of Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
item.description: Cheers erupted from a street-level crowd as Alex Honnold reached the top of the spire of the 508-meter (1,667-foot) tower, about 90 minutes after he s...

item.title: The Woman Who Stands Between Donald Trump and Greenland
item.description: Mette Frederiksen, Denmark’s leader, has taken big risks standing up to Mr. Trump. It might just be working — for now.

item.title: 5 things to know about the latest Minneapolis shooting
item.description: Tensions are escalating in Minneapolis after Alex Jeffrey Pretti, a U.S. citizen, was killed during an encounter with immigration officials on Saturda...

item.title: Here's how 'shared decision making' for childhood vaccines could limit access
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s new approach to six shots that were formerly given routinely will introduce new hurdles for getting kids immunized. And it cou...

item.title: Why Japan’s Leader Won’t Enter the Male-Dominated Sumo Ring
item.description: Sanae Takaichi, the first woman to lead Japan as prime minister, skipped a sumo awards ceremony, reflecting her cautious approach to gender issues.

item.title: Thousands of new Americans opt for 'ultimate act of inclusion' despite obstacles
item.description: Three citizenship ceremonies NPR attended in the Washington, D.C. area in January were largely celebratory experiences, despite a year of hurdles and ...

item.title: 40 years after Challenger: Lingering guilt and lessons learned
item.description: Forty years after the Challenger disaster, NPR explores the engineers' last-minute efforts to stop the launch, their decades of guilt and the vital le...

item.title: New York City Schools Announce Remote Learning Day in Response to Storm
item.description: With as much as a foot of snow expected to fall across the city, schools will be closed on Monday, Mayor Zohran Mamdani said.

item.title: The Woman Who Stands Between Donald Trump and Greenland
item.description: Mette Frederiksen, Denmark’s leader, has taken big risks standing up to Mr. Trump. It might just be working — for now.

item.title: The Podcaster Poking at France’s Biggest Secrets
item.description: Philippe Collin makes intricate series that are reshaping how French people understand uncomfortable parts of their history. Millions are tuning in.
